about.title: Who I am
about.story: Born in Albuquerque, New Mexico, raised in Boise, Idaho, and now based in Madison, Wisconsin. I'm a Computer Science and Data Science student at UW Madison with dual Swedish-American citizenship. I'm passionate about building production-ready ML systems and data products that solve real-world problems.
about.approach: My work focuses on the intersection of data science and software engineering. I specialize in real-time ETL pipelines, model training/serving, and interactive dashboards. I'm drawn to projects that combine technical complexity with practical applications.

projects.title: Projects
projects.description: End-to-end systems, distributed engines, and AI applications.

featured.title: Sentinel
featured.subtitle: Distributed Log Streaming Engine
featured.description: High-throughput distributed message queue architected from scratch. Engineered a custom LSM-tree storage engine in Go for high-write throughput (100k+ msg/s). Implemented partition-based replication with Raft-inspired leader election over gRPC. Developed a custom binary protocol for zero-copy transmission, reducing network overhead by 40%.

featured.title: Synapse
featured.subtitle: Real-time Collaborative Whiteboard
featured.description: Conflict-free collaborative workspace supporting 50+ concurrent users. Built a high-performance WebSocket server in Rust (Actix) using CRDTs (Yjs) for conflict-free state sync. Optimized rendering with WebAssembly and HTML5 Canvas for steady 60 FPS with 10k+ objects. Scaled via Redis Pub/Sub.

featured.title: Aura
featured.subtitle: 3D Audio-Reactive AI Universe
featured.description: Immersive generative art experience syncing 3D visuals with live audio. Developed a reactivity engine using Web Audio API for real-time FFT analysis mapped to Three.js shader uniforms. Wrote custom GLSL ray-marching shaders for volumetric lighting. Integrated OpenAI Whisper for lyric transcription and Stable Diffusion for texture generation.

featured.title: Madison Metro Bus ETA
featured.subtitle: End-to-end ML Pipeline
featured.description: ML pipeline predicting bus arrival times more accurately than official schedules. Architected ingestion pipe for GTFS-RT streams (1M+ positions/mo) into Postgres/PostGIS. Trained LSTM/Transformer models reducing MAE by 25%. Containerized inference API with Docker and deployed via GitHub Actions CI/CD ensuring 99.9% uptime.
